Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the game. Each player has a name and a collection of pieces.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Player(String name)
    Constructs a new player with the specified name.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name)
      Constructs a new player with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player. Pre-condition: The name must be a valid string. Post-condition: A player object is created with an empty list of pieces.

  • Method Details

    • addPiece

      public void addPiece(Piece piece)
      Adds a piece to the player's collection.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to be added. Pre-condition: The piece must be a valid Piece object. Post-condition: The piece is added to the player's list of pieces.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece(String pieceType)
      Retrieves an active piece of the specified type.
      Parameters:
      pieceType - The type of piece to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The piece if found and not captured, otherwise null. Pre-condition: The pieceType must be a valid string. Post-condition: Returns a matching piece if available, otherwise prints a message and returns null.

    • getAllPieces

      public List<Piece> getAllPieces()
      Retrieves all pieces owned by the player.
      Returns:
      A list of all pieces belonging to the player. Pre-condition: The player must have a list of pieces (can be empty). Post-condition: Returns the list of pieces owned by the player.

    • getActivePieces

      public List<Piece> getActivePieces()
      Retrieves all active (not captured) pieces owned by the player.
      Returns:
      A list of active pieces. Pre-condition: The player must have a list of pieces (can be empty). Post-condition: Returns a list containing only the pieces that are not captured.

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece(Piece piece, char direction, Board board)
      Moves a piece in the specified direction on the board.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to move.
      direction - The direction to move ('W' for up, 'S' for down, 'A' for left, 'D' for right).
      board - The game board. Pre-condition: The piece must exist and belong to the player. The direction must be valid (W, A, S, or D). The board must be a valid Board object. Post-condition: The piece moves if the move is valid. If an opponent's piece is in the target position and can be captured, it is removed. If the piece reaches the opponent's home base, a message is displayed.

    • hasLostAllPieces

      public boolean hasLostAllPieces()
      Checks if the player has lost all their pieces.
      Returns:
      true if all pieces are captured, false otherwise. Pre-condition: The player must have a list of pieces (can be empty). Post-condition: Returns true if no active pieces remain, otherwise returns false.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the player.
      Returns:
      The player's name. Pre-condition: The player's name must be initialized. Post-condition: Returns the name of the player.
